717469f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, from 42nd to 41st Streets. At the extreme left is the St. Cloud Hotel. The Rossmore Hotel is in the centre.
About 1885.
Brown Brothers.

717472f.text:
Broadway, south from and including West 41st Street.
Note the Broadway Theatre on the right, at the S.W.
corner of West 41st Street.
About 1905.
New York Edison Co.

717474f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from 41st to 43rd Streets. At the extreme right is the Hotel Aberdeen, later the Hotel Calvert, and later still the Calvert Building. In the centre is the Hotel Knickerbocker, soon to be converted into an office building. At the extreme left is the Hotel Wallick, later the Hotel Cadillac, and the Hotel Rector, later the Hotel Claridge.
About 1915.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.

712735f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, east from but not including Broadway, to
and including Sixth Ave.
About 1920.
Brown Brothers.

712737f-b.text:
(1)
41st Street, north side, west from, but not including,Broadway. The clearing in the foreground was left by the demolition of the Broadway Theatre. On the S. W. corner of Seventh Avenue stands the Cowan Building, built around 1924.
March 18,1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, including Broadway, and showing the new Bricken Textile building on the site of the Broadway Theatre; it almost completely hides the Cowan Building.
About 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

712737f-a.text:
(1)
41st Street, north side, west from, but not including,Broadway. The clearing in the foreground was left by the demolition of the Broadway Theatre. On the S. W. corner of Seventh Avenue stands the Cowan Building, built around 1924.

(2)

About 1933.
P. L. Sperr.

717463f-a.text:
1437-1439 Broadway, adjoining the S.W. corner of 41st Street, showing at the extreme right a portion of the clearing for the Bricken-Textile Building, which will occupy the south side of
41st Street from Broadway to Seventh Avenue.
March 10, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

717465f-a.text:
(1)
The Broadway Theatre, Broadway at the S.W. corner of 41st Street. his theatre will be rased in about a year and the 33-story BrickenTextile Building built on its site.
January 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A closer view of the Broadway Theatre.
January 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Clearing on the site of the Broadway Theatre where the BrickenTextile Building will be erected. Aoross the clearing may be seen
the N.W. corner of Seventh Avenue and 4lst Street.
March 10, 1929.
L. Sperr.

(1)

January 29, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)

March 10, 1929.
L. Sperr.

717466f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at 41st Street, showing, on the right, the Hotel Continental, which will be demolished within a year and replaced by the 43-story Continental Building, and on the left the Calvert Building, which will stand in 1936, seen from across the
wreckage of the Broadway Theatre.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the same.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

717466f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at 41st Street, showing, on the right, the Hotel Continental, which will be demolished within a year and replaced by the 43-story Continental Building, and on the left the Calvert Building, which will stand in 1936, seen from across the
wreckage of the Broadway Theatre.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another view of the same.
March 11, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

717468f-a.text:
The Hotel Continental, Broadway, at and adjoining the S.E. of 4lst Street. The hotel and the three-story building which : it are shortly to be demolished for the erection of the 43-sto
Continental Building.
About 1929.
Edwin Levick.

712736f-a.text:
41st Street, north side, at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Broadway, showing the Calvert Building, (formerly Calvert Hotel),on the corner, and the back door of the Bush Terminal Building at No. 139. No. 141 is a new 5 story building erected on the site of "Diamond Jim" Brady's old residence. The clearing in the right foreground is the site of the Broadway
Theatre.
May 22, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

723525f.text:
Broadway (diagonally from the lower left to the upper right), north from W. 41st to 48th Street as viewed westward from the air to show the Times Square area. Prominently shown are the Times ard the Paramount Buildings and the Hotel Astor. In the foreground appears the tower atop the Bush Terminal Bldg. on 42nd Street.
About 1930
Ewing Galloway
Neg.~ 2S9

717471f-a.text:
Broadway (center, across view, street level not seen)
from N. 41st (left) to 42nd (right) Streets as viewed westward from the Bush Terminal Building and showing
the upper portions of structures fronting on this
thoroughfare. Times Square and the Times Building are
to the right and do not appear.

July 30, 1930
P.L. Sperr

717467f-a.text:
(1)
The Hotel Continental, Broadway at the S.E. corner of 41st Street, two years before its demolition.
May 5, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, as seen across wreckage of the Broadway Theatre and from 570 Seventh Ave.
February 4, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
Neo. 21G

(1)
The Hotel Continental, Broadway at the S.E. corner of 41st Street, two years before its demolition.

717470f-a.text:
The Calvert Building, Broadway at the N.E. corner of 41st Street. At the right is the Continental Building, on the site of the old
Hotel Continental.
March 18, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
